channel.title: Business of Law on Ex Machina
channel.description: Recent content in Business of Law on Ex Machina

item.title: Lazy Legislation
item.description: Regulators today, are struggling to come to terms with the transformations that society is going through. As a result, the regulations they draft are often loosely worded to account for variations they cannot envisage. This is forcing businesses to adopt new and complex business models as they try to comply.

item.title: The Demise of the Artisanal Lawyer
item.description: The changes wrought by modern computational technologies seem to be far more fundamental than any that have come before it. The legal profession is not immune from these changes. What will change first are the clerical jobs that fresh associates are assigned as a way to learn on the job. What will we do to train our workforce once these jobs are performed by machines?
